basics.name: Rafael Oliveira
basics.label: PhD
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

work.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: Norwegian University of Science and Technology, Trondheim, Norway
courses: Bioinformatics Methods for Next Generation Sequencing

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

references.name: Adrian Zety, Chief Project Officer & Bioinformatician at Artificial Intelligence Expert
references.reference: From the moment of the first interview, Rafael left me the impression of a very dedicated and professional programmer. He is a bioinformatician and AI specialist focused on learning the cutting-edge technologies available in the industry and a true believer in life-long learning. I had the pleasure of working with him in developing an MVP for a product that can change the way we do bioinformatics, and I must say that he always makes time in his heavy PhD schedule to work and improve his skills never giving up on presenting results in some of the most organized ways I've ever seen. I think anyone would find Rafael a great addition in their team, wherever it's a biomedical team or a more IT-focused solutions company.

references.name: Lampros Androutsos, Product Manager at Artificial Intelligence Expert
references.reference: I had the opportunity to work alongside Rafael while developing a cutting-edge bioinformatics-machine learning MVP, and his expertise in bioinformatics and machine learning is exceptional. His proficiency in data analysis, algorithm development, machine learning and software development significantly contributed to our project's success. He is a collaborative team member, always willing to assist others and share his insights. His commitment to excellence is evident in his willingness to explore solutions to challenging problems, even outside regular work hours. Rafael’s dedication and expertise make him an invaluable asset to any team!

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
